title: Conservation of linear momentum - changing mass

content.question: Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is released from rest at the top of a ramp of height <math alttext="h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown. The block slides down the ramp onto a flat section and then collides and sticks to a second block of mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="m sub 2 equals m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. After the collision, the blocks have speed <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. Frictional forces between the blocks and the surface are negligible. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is then replaced with a block of mass <math alttext="2 m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and the scenario is repeated. Which of the following correctly indicates how the final speed <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> of the blocks will compare to the original scenario?

choices.label: It will decrease by a factor of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
It will decrease by a factor less than <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
It will increase by a factor less than <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
It will increase by a factor of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>

content.answer: It will increase by a factor less than <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
